page.title: 02The Market Cross
page.content: The cross must surely be one of the landmarks of the village.It was not until 1265 that Thomas De Astley was first granted a charter by Henry 111 to hold a regular market at Hillmorton.The charter allowed a weekly Saturday market to take place. This charter not valied because at the time the king was imprisoned and the barons claimed regal authority.In 1268 after the decisive battle of Evesham which freed the king and led to the death of Thomas De Astley.A new charter was proccured from the crown by Thomas De Astley 11.He did however change the market day for Wednesday. In 1335 yet another Thomas De Astley obtained a fresh charter for a Tuesday market and it is believed that he also had the red sandstone cross built.
